data.title: Added documentation for some clases (Variant, ToolButton, Button (partial), GradientTexture, BitMap, CollisionShape2D, CollisionShape)
data.body: Variant, ToolButton, Button (partial), GradientTexture, BitMap

data.title: Changed the text from "Cancel" to "Done" in the "Fix Dependencies" dialog.
data.body:
Changed the "Fix Dependencies" dialog button that closes the dialog to now say "Done".

Having the button the user needs to push labeled as "Cancel" is very confusing and leaves the impression that it will "cancel" the dependencies they've fixed and revert them back to being broken, which isn't the case.

data.title: Add linking to <member> and <enum> elements in the classes XML files
data.body:
Godot 3.0

Currently, people are only able to use [method method_name] (for linking methods) and [type_name] (for linking types) in the classes.xml document. Because of the growth of <member> elements in the new version however, it would be effective to add a corresponding [member member_name] link as well.

data.title: Rewrite the methods section of the IP class
Area2D Documentation + constants in _bind_methods
data.body: Please let me know if I should update anything.

data.title: Document the Script and GDScript classes
Updated KinematicBody2D to match the current KinematicBody.
data.body: this means added KinematicCollision2D and changed move -> move_and_collide, and simplified collision data methods

data.title: Error log becomes unusable when it has many lines
data.body:
Godot 3.0 master

One of my projects produced a lot of errors (1428), and I noticed the error list becomes extremely slow when I scroll down, even though only a few entries (10) are drawn.

Clicking items in it also becomes very slow, I have to wait a few seconds before I can see the call stack.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/30244807-fbf99b7a-95c5-11e7-9712-a87ba6af0b89.png)

data.title: Generic6DOFJoint broken
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot since merge https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/7426

**Issue description:**

 I was trying to port a project from 2.1 to 3 and I realized that the generic 6DOF joint isn't working, everything gets unstable, so I started tracking down the regression.
In this branch (https://github.com/m4nu3lf/godot/tree/bugfix/physics) it was working, so by rebuilding tons of different commits I've been able to find where things broke, and it is... just after the merge of the branch (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/7426)!
Diffing the physics server I couldn't see any major change before and after the merge so... long story short, the bug is in the Matrix3 and/or Transform classes. Not sure if the conventions have been changed without updating the physics engine, but if I revert just those 2 files to before the merge (fixing just a few compilation errors) everything works again


**Steps to reproduce:**
Create 2 rigid bodies and join them with a Generic6DOFJoint with angular constraints

data.title: Fill in BitMap class ref.
data.body:
This fills in the following for the BitMap class:

- Brief description
- Description
- All method descriptions

data.title: Color has no math operators
data.body:
Godot 3.0 master

In GDScript, adding two colors together results in an erorr:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/30244664-dea6cd02-95c2-11e7-9eb3-b32a1672d970.png)

It also doesn't have operators for `-`, `*` and `/`.

I think there should be the same operators for colors as if they were vectors, simply doing components memberwise. my current workaround is to do all components manually...
I know there is `blend`, but my current use case really is about adding or multiplying colors.

data.title: Mouse-over variable values are still shown after debugging session finished
data.body:
Godot 3.0 master
Windows 10 64 bits

I started a debugging session and once on an error or breakpoint I was able to see the values in variables by moving my mouse over them in the script editor, which is expected.

However, when I stopped the debugger and moved my mouse over variables, these tooltips are still shown, which isn't expected.

data.title: Removed code that flips normal if facing away from test direction
data.body: Removed bug causing code that's apparently not needed either according to reduz

data.title: Cannot pause script debugger in an infinite loop
data.body:
Godot 3.0 master
Windows 10 64 bits

I found it's not possible to pause a debugging session if the game is in an infinite loop. It was possible in 2.1.3, but in 3.0 it just hangs forever.

Tested on this:
```gdscript
extends Node

func _process(delta):
    while true:
        pass
```

data.title: Removed code that flips normal if facing away from test direction
data.body: Removed bug causing code that's apparently not needed either according to reduz

data.title: Script editor: Ctrl+click doesn't work on static functions
data.body:
Godot 3.0 master

Ctrl+click on a function call makes the script editor go to that function. It works on member functions, but as soon as the function is declared as `static`, it doesn't work and nothing happen.

Works:
```gdscript
func foo():
    pass

func bar():
    foo() # Ctrl+click leads to foo
```

Doesn't work:
```gdscript
static func foo():
    pass

func bar():
    foo() # Ctrl+click doesn't do anything
```

data.title: X11 - Hint the window manager to disable desktop compositing in fullscreen mode
data.body:
From https://specifications.freedesktop.org/wm-spec/latest/ar01s05.html :

"Some applications like fullscreen games might want run without the overhead of being redirected offscreen (to avoid extra copies) and thus perform better."

data.title: Fixed the methods 'resource_changed' to be virtual since they can be overridden with GDScript.
data.body: See issue #11104

data.title: Fix errors at exit (2.1)
data.body:
## Fix WASAPI cleanup
Audio drivers are destroyed on OS destruction, when memory management is no longer available so they must release their dynamic allocations explicitly in their `finish()` method.

~## Fix crash at editor exit related to BB10~
~Caused by a recent change in BB10 polling thread behaviour.~

| | scene/3d/camera.cpp: | ClassDB::bind_method(D_METHOD("project_**position**", "screen_point"), &Camera::project_**position**); | | scene/3d/physics_body.cpp: | ClassDB::bind_method(D_METHOD("get_**position**"), &KinematicCollision::get_**position**); | | scene/3d/remote_transform.cpp: | ClassDB::bind_method(D_METHOD("set_update_**position**", "update_remote_**position**"), &RemoteTransform::set_update_**position**); | | scene/3d/remote_transform.cpp: | ClassDB::bind_method(D_METHOD("get_update_**position**"), &RemoteTransform::get_update_**position**); | | scene/3d/spatial_velocity_tracker.cpp: | ClassDB::bind_method(D_METHOD("update_**position**", "**position**"), &SpatialVelocityTracker::update_**position**); | | scene/3d/spatial_velocity_tracker.cpp: | ClassDB::bind_method(D_METHOD("reset", "**position**"), &SpatialVelocityTracker::reset); | | scene/gui/control.cpp: | ClassDB::bind_method(D_METHOD("set_**position**", "pos"), &Control::set_**position**); | | scene/gui/control.cpp: | ClassDB::bind_method(D_METHOD("set_global_**position**", "pos"), &Control::set_global_**position**); | | scene/gui/control.cpp: | ClassDB::bind_method(D_METHOD("get_**position**"), &Control::get_**position**); | | scene/gui/control.cpp: | ClassDB::bind_method(D_METHOD("get_global_**position**"), &Control::get_global_**position**); | | scene/main/node.cpp: | ClassDB::bind_method(D_METHOD("get_**position**_in_parent"), &Node::get_**position**_in_parent); | | scene/main/viewport.cpp: | ClassDB::bind_method(D_METHOD("get_mouse_**position**"), &Viewport::get_mouse_**position**); | | servers/arvr/arvr_**position**al_tracker.cpp: | ClassDB::bind_method(D_METHOD("get_tracks_**position**"), &ARVRPositionalTracker::get_tracks_**position**); | | servers/arvr/arvr_**position**al_tracker.cpp: | ClassDB::bind_method(D_METHOD("get_**position**"), &ARVRPositionalTracker::get_**position**); | | servers/arvr/arvr_**position**al_tracker.cpp: | ClassDB::bind_method(D_METHOD("_set_rw_**position**", "rw_**position**"), &ARVRPositionalTracker::set_rw_**position**); |

  Should some of those be renamed before 3.0? Autocompletion makes it easy to deal with but in some cases like for example `CanvasItem` having `get_global_mouse_position` and `get_local_mouse_pos` are bit weird.

data.title: EditorSelection.get_selected_nodes() always returns an empty array
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Win 7, [Godot-Windows-x86_64-2017-09-08.519b933](https://bintray.com/calinou/godot/editor/2017-09-08.519b933#files), also on 2.1.3

**Issue description:**
Tested with this tool script:
```
tool
extends Node

func _ready():
	set_process(true)
	
func _process(delta):
	var es = EditorSelection.new()
	print(es.get_selected_nodes())
```
This should print the current selected nodes to the console, but it will return an empty array when nodes are selected.

data.title: Update Timer class ref.
get_global_mouse_position() offset when in tool mode
data.body:
![godotmouse](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1927518/30243403-39754286-95a0-11e7-970b-6b7a0f36c3ae.gif)


**Issue description:**
It seems as if the mouse position as reported by get_global_mouse_position() is incorrect when in tool mode. It seems to be offset the same amount regardless of zoom level.

This only happens when in tool mode. When running in game mode the mouse position is correct.
It seems to be related to the position of the game viewport, if you increase the width of the sidebar, the mouse offset also increases.

This is with the Godot_v3.0-alpha1_win64 build. 2.x does not seem to have the same issue.

**Link to minimal example project:**
```python
tool

extends Node2D

func _process(delta):
	update()

func _draw():
	draw_line(Vector2(), get_global_mouse_position() - get_global_position(), Color(1,0,0), 1, true)
```

data.title: Document Line2D
UX: don't offset the whole script editor when search just opens
data.body:
Godot 3.0 master

When I use Ctrl+F to use incremental search, it makes this panel appear on top:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/30243105-06290d06-95a3-11e7-9a2a-5b8db58761f9.png)

But this offsets all lines down, and sometimes also searches first occurrence immediately, which I didn't expect:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mTwckJRsin0&feature=youtu.be
(all I do in this video is pressing Ctrl+F)

Would it be possible to keep lines where they are when this opens, treat this panel like an "overlay"?
Also start the search only when the Enter key is pressed? It would be a good UX improvement.

data.title: Update TextureRect class ref
Make Node.queue_free's documentation description a little more verbose
data.body: Just ensuring we're a little more truthful to how it actually works. Nothing big.

data.title: Implemented DirAccess get_drive and get_drive_count for OS X
data.body: File dialog will now show the volumes on OS X.

data.title: Spotlight gizmo forward vector is the same as editor camera forward vector
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Linux, d1cb73b47a17de830d9474026ffa7b3587cfbc68

**Issue description:**
I noticed that gizmo of spotlight acts in a very weird fashion, it looks like spotlight gizmo is mimicking editor camera:
![spotlight_gizmo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6129594/30241712-26663144-9589-11e7-9db1-60feadb00536.gif)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Open new scene
2. Add `SpotLight` node to the scene
3. Ensure `SpotLight` node is selected
4. Rotate camera
